Compiler

The details laid out here are mostly for documenting the implementation process, but here they are nonetheless.

Tokenization

The compilation process begins by reading the contents of a source file, namely the main.blam file. Once the source contents are read, the tokenizer creates a CONTENT node using the entirety of the file. CONTENT nodes are then iteratively tokenized according to a rule specified by a certain regular expression. Tokenization of source content is complete when either CONTENT nodes have been parsed or until all rules have been parsed.

For example take the following source which will be tokenized with the STRING, OP_EQ, ANUM, and SPACE rules, enumerated by B, C, D, and E respectively (with A enumerating CONTENT): 

str a = "this is a string"
